Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Humana Inc. agreed to pay $1,814,000 for allegedly submitting prescription drug event date claims that included sales tax from Louisiana pharmacies even though Medicare Part D drugs were not taxable under Louisiana law as of July 1, 2006.

Company: Humana Health Plan of Texas, Inc
Humana Insurance Company and Humana Health Plan of Texas, Inc.
Description: In 2015, Humana initiated a strategy to simplify the number of individual health products it offered in Texas and, eventually, withdrew from the Texas individual health market in 2018. Terminations that occurred in 2016 as part of that strategy violated Texas insurance laws. Additionally, the Texas Department of Insurance discovered instances in which Humana used unapproved association plan forms and failed to notify associations of changes to policy language upon renewal. Lastly, between 2014 and 2017, Humana violated  regulations by rating small employers as if they were large employers. Humana agreed to pay a $500,000 administrative penalty and $139,607.33 in restitution.

Agency: Wisconsin Office of the Commissioner of Insurance

Description: Humana agreed to pay $750,000 in settlement of a market conduct examination finding it failed to comply with multiple insurance regulations and failed to follow recommendations of previous examinations.

Description: Humana agreed to pay $1.8 million to a group of states to resolve allegations that it improperly required companies purchasing small group medical insurance to purchase a group life insurance product as well. It also agreed to create a $2.7 million consumer restitution pool.
